intro: Centaurium minus subsp. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many showy, often blue or purple flowering species. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, with five lobes that are slightly notched. The species is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves.
